intro: Sumbaviopsis, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a genus of flowering plants native to Madagascar. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored flowers. The plants typically have fleshy, strap-shaped leaves and produce intricate, showy blooms that attract various pollinators. Sumbaviopsis species are often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, many species are threatened with extinction.
